title: Are the cardinalities equal (general topology, proof writing, solution verification, and math)? - Quora

response.answer_text: Two sets AA and BB have the same cardinality if there exists a bijection between them. Given the Schröder–Bernstein Theorem all we need is an injection f:A→Bf:A→B and another injection g:B→Ag:B→A. The Schröder–Bernstein Theorem guarantees that there exists a bijection between AA and BB. If we can’t come up with a bijection between two sets, then we cannot associate members of one set with members of another. They have different cardinalities.

No they aren’t. One is infinite and the other isn’t. Oh. Did you mean something different? How about editing your question so that we have some idea what cardinalities you are talking about. My guess is that you won’t because you are not a person. You are a bot of some sort.
